alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 10:03PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. .Light to moderate rain that fell earlier Saturday in Pine County on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of runoff. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River near Pine City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, This will cause flooding near Cross Lake near Pine City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Sunday morning to a crest of 9.8 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday night. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 05/09/1950. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Snake River Pine City 9.0 8.7 Sat 9 pm CDT 9.2 9.6 9.8 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon by 400 PM CDT.
